A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: An ambitious effort\, this well-produced film contains a plot element so catastrophically flawed that it basically destroys the entire Star Wars franchise.  In this film\, Luke Skywalker is a washed-up loser.  This is an unthinkable circumstance\, and is entirely unrealistic.  It is well-known now that Mark Hamill also objected to this portrayal of Luke\, but the \"brilliant\" writers pressed on!  I believe that The Last Jedi will go down in history as the most destructive Gil in movie history.  At the end\, the lazy risk averse Luke Sywalker (what???  Did I have to write that?) \"phones in\" his last battle with a well-played and well-developed Kylo Ren.  What a disgrace.  I'm not sure I can ever watch the original films again\, knowing that Luke ends up giving up on good and giving up on himself after all is said and done.  I will never buy a piece of Star Wars merchandise again\, and if I find out who\, specifically\, is responsible for destroying Luke Skywalker\, I cannot say what I could be capable of.  How this got past the highly-paid Disney executives is unimaginable.  Many people should lose their jobs over this insane blunder of a film.
